env/install.txt

Installation instructions

 1. First make sure that git is installed, which the project requires.
    (macos: "brew install git"; ubuntu: "apt-get install git")
      $ git --version

 2. Install a virtual python2.7 environment, with either conda or virtualenv,
    along with the project's pythong packages.

      anaconda :
         2a.  Install conda from e.g. http://conda.pydata.org/miniconda.html
	        $ conda --version  # check to see if you have it.
	 2b.  Create an "umber" virtual python that includes the prereqs
  	        $ conda create -n umber python=2.7 anaconda --file environment.yml

      virtualenv :
         2a.  Get python2.7 and a compatible virtualenv
	      if you don't already have them. (See python.org.)
	        $ python --version
		$ virtualenv --version
	      (Probably already installed; otherwise see e.g. python.org/)
	 2b.  From the project root folder (umber)
	        $ virtualenv --python=python2.7 venv
         2c.  Load the python libraries.
	        $ pip install -r env/requirements.txt

 3. Turn on the python environmentn with either

         $ . env/_activate_conda
    or	

         $ . env/activate_virtualenv     

    which also sets up the project environment variables.

    Or better yet, symlink env/activate to one of these. :)

--------------------------------------------------------

After changes to the installed packages, the specs can be updated with

  $ conda env export > environment_new.yml
  
or

  $ pip freeze > requirements_new.txt
